StartView.title: Citasion: Getting Started
StartView.content:
## Getting started

 Citasion offers smart reference management for you and your collaborators. You can import papers from all major research aggregators (e.g., Google Scholar), and manage the imported references together with your collaborators. With the help of our browser extensions and add-ons, you can write collaboratively and easily cite the imported papers in Google Docs, Word, and Overleaf. There are over 1,000 reference styles that you can choose from.

 To start Citasion, you will need to create [a Citasion account](/register) and install Citasion browser extension. Citasion supports a variety of browsers, such as: 

 - [Chrome](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/citasion/oklpcimghhhhanifldcdlfgoaigfiolj) ![Chrome ><](/static/images/docs/chrome-tiny.png)

 - [Firefox](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/citasion/) ![Firefox ><](/static/images/docs/firefox-tiny.png)

 - [Edge](https://microsoftedge.microsoft.com/addons/detail/citasion/kgcdgjmildkboglkjlmllmkchhibgbcc) ![Edge ><](/static/images/docs/edge-tiny.png)

 If you write papers in Word, you will also need to install our [Word Add-in](https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/WA200003530?tab=Overview) ![Word](/static/images/docs/word-tiny.png).

 Paper importation is typically the first step for reference management. To learn more about how to import papers in a batch or via one-click importation, please check out [this article](/docs/import-manage-papers).

 Citasion supports writing in major writing tools, such as Word, Google Docs, and OverLeaf. To learn more about how to use Citasion in writing, please check out the following articles:

 - [How to use Citasion in Word](/docs/citasion-word)

 - [How to use Citasion in Google Docs](/docs/citasion-googledocs)

 - [How to use Citasion in Overleaf](/docs/citasion-overleaf)

 To learn more about sharing Citasion with your collaborators, please check out [this article](/docs/collaborate).

 To learn more about billing, please check out [this article](/docs/billing).

ImportView.title: Citasion: Import Papers to Citasion
ImportView.content: ## Overview This section covers: * [Import data from other programs](#importData) * [Parse PDF papers](#parsePapers) * [Upload PDF papers](#uploadPapers) * [Copy and Paste your BibTeX entries](#copyBibtex) * [One-click paper importation](#oneClick) ## Import data from other programs You can import exported data from other programs such as Mendeley, EndNote, or PubMed. Citasion can import references of the following types: - BibTeX (.bib) - RIS (.ris) - NBIB (.nbib) - EndNote XML (.xml) To import exported data to a Citasion project, you can: 1. open the project you want to import your data into 2. click Add references to this project 3. click Upload Reference Files 4. drag and drop your exported data files into the upload dialog 5. click Submit to begin If you haven't decided on how to organize your reference data, or they don't naturally fit into a project, you can: 1. click References on the left navigation menu 2. click ADD REFERENCES 3. click Upload Reference Files 4. drag and drop your exported data files into the upload dialog 5. click Submit to begin Regardless of importing references to a particular Citasion project or not, Citasion will parse the exported data and import all your data. A message will be displayed for any errors or warnings encountered during the import process. ## Parse PDF papers Before discovering Citasion, you may have saved your papers in PDF format in some folders on your computer. You can use any collection of unorganized PDFs as a starting point for your first Citasion project. 1. open the project you want to import your papers into 2. click Add references to this project 3. click Parse PDF Files 4. drag and drop some files into the upload dialog 5. click Submit to begin If you haven't decided on how to organize your PDF papers, or they don't naturally fit into a project, you can: 1. click References on the left navigation menu 2. click ADD REFERENCES 3. click Parse PDF Files 4. drag and drop your exported data files into the upload dialog 5. click Submit to begin Citasion does not store PDF papers for free-tier users, but will parse each PDF and use all detectable metadata to create reference entries. However, it is worth noting that many PDF papers do not have proper metadata to be parsed. ## Upload PDF papers For premium users, the parsing PDF papers function is upgraded and replaced with uploading PDF papers. You can use any collection of unorganized PDFs as a starting point for your first Citasion project. 1. open the project you want to import your papers into 2. click Add references to this project 3. click Upload PDF Files 4. drag and drop some files into the upload dialog 5. click Submit to begin If you haven't decided on how to organize your PDF papers, or they don't naturally fit into a project, you can: 1. click References on the left navigation menu 2. click ADD REFERENCES 3. click Upload PDF Files 4. drag and drop your exported data files into the upload dialog 5. click Submit to begin Citasion provides unlimited storage for PDF papers, and will parse each PDF and use all detectable metadata to create reference entries. ## Copy and Paste your BibTeX entries If you are not familiar with BibTeX, you can find more information about BibTeX here. If you have a list of BibTeX entries, you can import them into a Citasion project via coping and pasting. 1. open the project you want to import the data into 2. click Add references to this project 3. click Copy & Paste BibTeX 4. copy and paste your BibTeX entries 5. click Submit to begin If the BibTeX entries don't naturally fit into a single project, you can: 1. click References on the left navigation menu 2. click ADD REFERENCES 3. click Copy & Paste BibTeX 4. copy and paste your BibTeX entries 5. click Submit to begin Citasion will parse all BibTeX entries to create reference entries in your project. A message will be displayed for any errors or warnings encountered during the import process. ## One-click paper importation Citasion supports automatic paper importation on multiple academic search aggregators, such as: - Google Scholar - ACM Library - IEEE Xplore - Springer - Pubmed To use this function, you will need to install Citasion extension in your browser. Citasion supports a variety of browsers, such as: - [Chrome](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/citasion/oklpcimghhhhanifldcdlfgoaigfiolj) ![Chrome ><](/static/images/docs/chrome-tiny.png) - [Firefox](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/citasion/) ![Firefox ><](/static/images/docs/firefox-tiny.png) - [Edge](https://microsoftedge.microsoft.com/addons/detail/citasion/kgcdgjmildkboglkjlmllmkchhibgbcc) ![Edge ><](/static/images/docs/edge-tiny.png) When you are on academic search aggregator (e.g., Google Scholar), you will see Citasion buttons appearing under each paper: ![Google Scholar button](/static/images/docs/googleScholar.png) Each Citasion button is composed of two parts. You can click the right side to choose the project that you want to import this paper to, or create a new project. You can click the left side to import this paper to the chosen project.

MigrateView.title: Citasion: Migrate from Other Services
MigrateView.content: ## Overview In general, you can migrate your data from other services to Citasion in two easy steps: 1. export data from other services first 2. upload the exported data to your target Citasion project The following content only covers how to export data from other services: * [Migrate from Mendeley](#mendeley) * [Migrate from Zotero](#zotero) * [Migrate from EndNote](#endnote) * [Migrate from Papers](#papers) You can find more on how to upload the exported data to a Citasion project in this article. ## Migrate from Mendeley You can export your Mendeley library in a few easy steps: 1. select all papers in your Mendeley library and choose File > Export ... 2. change the format to RIS 3. save the exported RIS file to your computer After that, you can follow this instruction to upload the exported data to a Citasion project. ## Migrate from Zotero You can export your Zotero library in a few easy steps: 1. select all papers in your Zotero library and choose File > Export Library ... 2. change the export format to RIS with all options checked 3. save the exported RIS file to your computer After that, you can follow this instruction to upload the exported data to a Citasion project. ## Migrate from EndNote You can export your EndNote library in a few easy steps: 1. open your EndNote library and click File > Export..., under output style choose **Select Another Style** 2. in the newly opened dialog, choose RIS (RefMan Ris Export) or XML (*.xml); make sure to uncheck **export selected references** to ensure that your entire library is exported 3. save the exported RIS or XML file to your computer After that, you can follow this instruction to upload the exported data to a Citasion project. ## Migrate from Papers You can export your Papers library in a few easy steps: 1. open your Papers library, and click File > Export... > RefMan RIS File 2. save the exported RIS file to your computer After that, you can follow this instruction to upload the exported data to a Citasion project.

ManageView.title: Citasion: Manage Papers on Citasion
ManageView.content:
## Overview Citasion provides two different approaches for reference management. The first approach is project-oriented. The second approach is reference-oriented. This section covers the two approaches in the following subsections: * [How do I manage references in a project?](#project) * [How do I manage all references?](#references) ## How do I manage references in a project?

In each Citasion project that you create or is shared with you by collaborators, you can:

- search for references - delete references - update references - add new references manually To add a reference manually: 1. open your project on the web application 2. click Add References 3. click Add A Reference Manually 4. input reference information To update a reference: 1. open your project on the web application 2. click button in the right top corner of the reference entry you want to update 3. click Update button 4. update the reference information To delete a reference from a project: 1. open your project on the web application 2. click button in the right top corner of the reference entry you want to update 3. click Delete button ## How do I manage all references?

You can access the reference views by clicking References on the left navigation menu on your dashboard. The reference view allows you to access and modify all references across different projects. Similar to the project view, you can: - search for references - delete references - update references - add new references manually - add references to a project To add references to a project, you can: 1. check all the references you want to add 2. select the project in the right sidebar 3. click Confirm

WordView.title: Citasion: Write with Citasion in Word
WordView.content: ## Overview This section covers: * [How do I start using Citasion in Word?](#start) * [How do I add in-text citations in Word?](#citations) * [How do I add references in Word?](#references) * [How do I change the bibliography style in Word?](#style) ## How do I start using Citasion in Word? Citasion Word add-in can be installed directly from [Microsoft App Source](https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/WA200003530?tab=Overview) . It is worth noting that Word add-in does not support one-click reference importation. If you want to use one-click reference importation, you need to install Citasion browser extension. Citasion extensions can be found for all major browsers: - [Chrome](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/citasion/oklpcimghhhhanifldcdlfgoaigfiolj) ![Chrome ><](/static/images/docs/chrome-tiny.png) - [Firefox](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/citasion/) ![Firefox ><](/static/images/docs/firefox-tiny.png) - [Edge](https://microsoftedge.microsoft.com/addons/detail/citasion/kgcdgjmildkboglkjlmllmkchhibgbcc) ![Edge ><](/static/images/docs/edge-tiny.png) Before you can start using Citasion in Word, you need to associate the Word document you are working on with one of your Citasion projects. Citasion only pulls references to your Word document from the associated Citasion project. To associate a Word Doc with a Citasion project, please do: 1. click the Citasion button 2. click **Set associated project** button 3. choose the project you want to associate your Word Doc to in the popup window 4. click **Change associated project** button ## How do I add in-text citations in Word? You can add in-text citations by: 1. stopping your cursor at where you want to insert citations 2. clicking Citasion >> Insert citation button, or press Ctrl and M at the same time 3. searching for the citations you want to add in the popup window, and add citations accordingly ## How do I add references in Word? You can add references by: 1. stopping your cursor at where you want to insert references (typically at the end of a document) 2. clicking Citasion >> Insert references button 3. waiting for the references to load ## How do I change the bibliography style in Word? You can change the bibliography style by: 1. clicking Citasion >> change bibliography style button 2. waiting for the new style to be rendered

OverleafView.title: Citasion: Write with Citasion in Overleaf
OverleafView.content: ## Overview This section covers: * [How do I start using Citasion in Overleaf?](#start) * [How do I add in-text citations in Overleaf?](#citations) * [How do I add references in Overleaf?](#references) * [What if I add more in-text citations after adding my references?](#more) ## How do I start using Citasion in Overleaf? With Citasion browser extension, you can easily cite the references from any of your Citasion projects in Overleaf. Citasion extensions can be found for all major browsers: - [Chrome](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/citasion/oklpcimghhhhanifldcdlfgoaigfiolj) ![Chrome ><](/static/images/docs/chrome-tiny.png) - [Firefox](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/citasion/) ![Firefox ><](/static/images/docs/firefox-tiny.png) - [Edge](https://microsoftedge.microsoft.com/addons/detail/citasion/kgcdgjmildkboglkjlmllmkchhibgbcc) ![Edge ><](/static/images/docs/edge-tiny.png) Before you can start using Citasion in Overleaf, you need to associate the Overleaf Doc you are working on with one of your Citasion projects. Citasion only pulls references to your Overleaf Doc from the associated Citasion project. To associate an Overleaf Doc with a Citasion project, please do: 1. click the Citasion button on the Overleaf menu on the top navigation bar 2. click **Set associated project** button 3. choose the project you want to associate your Overleaf Doc to in the popup window 4. click **Change associated project** button ## How do I add in-text citations in Overleaf? You can add in-text citations by: 1. stopping your cursor at where you want to insert citations 2. clicking Citasion >> Insert citation button, or press Ctrl and M at the same time 3. searching for the citations you want to add in the popup window, and add citations accordingly ## How do I add references in Overleaf? You can add references by: 1. clicking Citasion >> Insert references button 2. name the reference file as you desire in the popup window, and click Create button 3. change the linked reference file to the newly created bib file in your main tex file ## What if I add more in-text citations after adding my references? If you add more in-text cittions after adding your references, you can always refresh your reference file to bring it up-to-date. 1. locate the reference file that was generated by Citasion in the left side navigation bar of Overleaf 2. click the reference file 3. click the Refresh button

CollaborateView.title: Citasion: Collaborate with Others
CollaborateView.content: ## Overview This section covers: * [How do I share a Citasion project with my collaborators?](#share) * [What do I exactly share with my collaborators when I share a Citasion project with them?](#what-to-share) * [Can my collaborators and I use Citasion in the same Google Docs?](#google-doc) # How do I share a Citasion project with my collaborators? You can share a Citasion project with your collaborators working on the same paper easily. To do that, you need to login your account. On the home dashboard or inside the view of a project, you can click the Share button and type the emails of your collaborators. You can enter more than one email address, and separate them by clicking the 'Enter' key on the keyboard. After all emails are entered, don't forget to click the Share button. Your collaborators will be notified via email. # What do I exactly share with my collaborators when I share a Citasion project with them? When you share a Citasion project with your collaborators, they will be able to access and manage references in the shared project, and cite the added references from this project when they write the same or a different academic paper. Any changes, such as adding new references or reference updates in the shared project are synchronized on a real-time basis and will be visible to all users of that project. # Can my collaborators and I use Citasion in the same Google Docs? Your collaborators and you will be able to use Citasion to insert citations and style references in the same Google Docs. This also applies to Word and Overleaf.

BillingBasicsView.title: Citasion: Billing and Subscription
BillingBasicsView.content: ## Overview This section covers: * [How do I purchase a premium subscription?](#purchase) * [What payment methods do you accept?](#payment-methods) * [Can I change my premium subscription?](#change-subscription) * [How do I access my receipts?](#access-receipts) ## How do I purchase a premium subscription? You can purchase a premium subscription by visiting [https://citasion.com/go-premium](https://citasion.com/go-premium). Or if you are on the default plan (free), you can click the Premium button on your home dashboard after logging in. We currently offer three types of premium subscriptions: * Monthly plan * Quarterly plan * Annual plan ## What payment methods do you accept? We accept all major credit cards and Paypal. ## Can I change my premium subscription? Yes! You can change your subscription details in your Citasion account. It's easy: 1. Log in to your Citasion account 2. Click on the Account tab to the left 3. Choose Subscription tab You can change your subscription in the following ways: * change your payment method * change your subscription plan * cancel your subscription ## How do I access my receipts? To access your receipts, go to the Subscription tab on the Account page and click the See My Receipt button. You can view each of your receipts online or choose to download a PDF version.

AccountManagementView.content: ## Overview This section covers: * [I can't remember my password. What should I do?](#password) * [I can't log into my Citasion account using Google/Microsoft in the Word environment. What should I do?](#social-account) * [I have already created an account using Google/Microsoft. Can I log into the same account using email and password?](#password-authentication) ## I can't remember my password. What should I do? You must be using email/password for authentication. If you forget your password, you can click **Trouble signing in?** when visiting the Login page, and follow the steps to recover your password. After providing your email address for resetting your password, you should receive the password resetting email in minutes. If you can not find the password resetting email in your inbox, you may check your Spam box. ## I can't log into my Citasion account using Google/Microsoft in the Word environment. What should I do? The authentication is not stable in the Word environment. We have received multiple reports from users that authentication using Google/Microsoft may fail in the Word environment. If that happens to you, you can enable password login for your account, and log into your Citasion account using email/password in the Word environment. To enable password login for your account, you can refer to the answer of the next question. ## I have already created an account using Google/Microsoft. Can I log into the same account using email and password? Yes. You can enable password login for the same account. To do so, you need to follow the steps below: * navigate to and log into Citasion via your regular browser * click **Account** on the left navigation bar * on the Account page, click **ENABLE PASSWORD LOGIN** You will be redirected to re-authenticate yourself, and set up email/password login for the same account. After enabling password login, you can verify the status of your account by visiting the [/account](https://citasion.com/account) page again; if the password login is successfully enabled, you should see that listed in yoour Account status:
